result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount reamining due andowing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with Takra B., UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review to be set by the Agent

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
.
On Court's own motion, the penalty enhancer, Domestic Abuse, is stricken.  
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with Takra B., UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This case is being heard for branch 40, Judge Dallet. 
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for projected guilty plea.  Court has an ASL Interprter trial that is ready to be held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jonathan M Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for plea hearing. However, due to the Jury Trial date being adjourned on case #15CF1134, the plea date will move to allign with the aforementioned case.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  24 hour curfew with release for legal only.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for trial.  Court has other trials ready to go, state cannot get one of the witnesses today.  Court ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jonathan M Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court has another trial with citizen witnesses ready to go.  Another court could not be found to take this trial.  Court ordered matter adjourned for jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case joined with 12CM4098 and 14CF1245 for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
